<<<<<<< HEAD
The perfect speech of Mr. John Gibbons, as it was delivered by himself on the scaffold at Tower-hill, on Friday the 22 of August, 1651 : being the same day that Mr. Love (the minister) was also executed. : Likewise his desires to the people; his protestation touching religion, and his true prayer immediately before his head was severed from his shoulders. ; Published by a perfect copy, at the request and for general satisfaction to his friends and others. Gibbons, John, d. 1651.
[1], 13 p.
Printed for T. Cook, London : 1651.
Reproduction of original in: Sutro Library.
=======
The perfect speech of Mr. John Gibbons, as it was delivered by himself on the scaffold at Tower-hill, on Friday the 22 of August, 1651 : being the same day that Mr. Love (the minister) was also executed. : Likewise his desires to the people; his protestation touching religion, and his true prayer immediately before his head was severed from his shoulders. ; Published by a perfect copy, at the request and for general satisfaction to his friends and others. Gibbons, John, d. 1651.
[1], 13 p.
Printed for T. Cook, London : 1651.
Reproduction of original in: Sutro Library.
T. Cook
